identificationModule.briefTitle: Enlighten Study: The EV-ICD Post Approval Registry
identificationModule.officialTitle: Enlighten Study: The EV-ICD Post Approval Registry

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Medtronic is sponsoring Enlighten: The EV-ICD Post Approval Registry, to further confirm safety and effectiveness of EV-ICD in routine clinical practice, following commercial release of EV-ICD devices.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The Enlighten Study is a global, prospective, observational, multi-site registry study. This study is conducted within Medtronic's post-market surveillance platform.

Eligibility for enrollment is based on market release dates for EV-ICD System within the geography in which the subject is enrolled.

Patients enrolled in the Enlighten Study will be prospectively followed for the life time of device post-implant or until registry closure, patient death or patient exit from the registry (i.e., withdrawal of consent).

Successfully implanted patients are expected to have scheduled follow-up visits approximately every 6 months, but at least annually, or as prompted by reportable adverse events. The total estimated registry duration is is through lifetime of device.

interventions.name: Defibrillation using EV-ICD
interventions.description: Device: Defibrillation using the Extravascular ICD (EV-ICD)

primaryOutcomes.description: To demonstrate 5-year Aurora EV-ICD major system-related complication-free survival \> 79%

secondaryOutcomes.measure: System and/or procedure related complication-free survival
secondaryOutcomes.description: To estimate the Aurora EV-ICD major system and/or procedure related complication-free survival probability as a function of time post-implant
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Procedure related complications assessed during and after the procedure/surgery; system related complications assessed through the study completion (12 years average), and assessed every year (1 year, 2 years, 3 years, … 12 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Characterize the rate of abnormal battery depletion complications as a function of time post-implant
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed through the study completion (12 years average), and assessed every year (1 year, 2 years, 3 years, … 12 years)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Summarize all device system revisions (e.g., reposition, replacement, explant) including reasons for modification and action taken
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed through the study completion (12 years average), and assessed every year (1 year, 2 years, 3 years, … 12 years)
Assessed through the study completion (12 years average), and assessed every year (1 year, 2 years, 3 years, … 12 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patient demographics and baseline medical history
secondaryOutcomes.description: Summarize patient demographics and baseline medical history
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed through the study completion (12 years average), and assessed every year (1 year, 2 years, 3 years, … 12 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To characterize defibrillation shock effectiveness for terminating spontaneous VT/VF arrhythmia
secondaryOutcomes.description: Characterize high voltage therapy effectiveness on device detected spontaneous ventricular episodes
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed through the study completion (12 years average), and assessed every year (1 year, 2 years, 3 years, … 12 years)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Characterize lead location and lead motion at implant.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Characterize lead location and lead motion at implant.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed through the study completion (12 years average), and assessed every year (1 year, 2 years, 3 years, … 12 years)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient or legally authorized representative provides written authorization and/or consent per institution and geographical requirements
* Patient is intended to receive or be treated with a EV-ICD device System and must be enrolled prior to the EV-ICD device implant procedure

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient who is, or is expected to be, inaccessible for follow-up
* Patient is excluded by local local law
* Patient is currently enrolled or plans to enroll in any concurrent drug and/or device study that may confound the PSR results
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients intended to be implanted with a EV-ICD system are eligible for enrollment and all patients must be consented prior to implant. Geographies with regulatory approval for the EV-ICD system are eligible to enroll patients (see locations section). All patients enrolled and successfully implanted with an EV-ICD system will be followed for lifetime of device, unless a patient is exited from the registry due to an unavoidable reason such as death, physician discretion, or patient withdrawal of consent. If EV-ICD system is not successfully implanted, patients will be exited from the registry unless a EV-ICD System and/or implant procedure related event is identified, for which the patient will be followed until the event is resolved or no further actions need to be taken.
